holidays.name: Scrabble Day
holidays.description: A celebration of the classic word game Scrabble, where players come together to create words, challenge their vocabulary, and show off their strategic skills.
holidays.origin: Scrabble was invented by Alfred Mosher Butts in 1938, and April 13 honors the game by encouraging everyone to play and appreciate this timeless word puzzle.
holidays.funFact: The highest-scoring Scrabble word ever played was 'OXYPHENBUTAZONE,' worth an incredible 1778 points! This day inspires players to find their own high-scoring gems.

holidays.name: Thomas Jefferson Day
holidays.description: Honors the third U.S. president Thomas Jefferson, known for his role in drafting the Declaration of Independence and his contributions to American history.
holidays.origin: April 13 is Jefferson's birthday, making it a day to remember his legacy in politics, architecture, and science.
holidays.funFact: Jefferson was not only a president but also an inventor, architect, and avid gardener who designed his estate Monticello almost entirely by himself.

holidays.name: Scrabble Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to the fantastic word game that challenges your vocabulary and wit! Perfect for word nerds and competitive players alike.
holidays.origin: This day celebrates the birthday of Alfred Mosher Butts, the inventor of Scrabble, born on April 13, 1899.
holidays.funFact: The original Scrabble game was called 'Criss-Cross Words' before Butts renamed it to Scrabble, meaning 'to scratch frantically.'

holidays.name: Chicken Cordon Bleu Day
holidays.description: A delicious celebration of the classic dish made of chicken breast wrapped around ham and cheese, then breaded and fried to golden perfection.
holidays.origin: This food holiday appreciates the comfort and sophistication of Chicken Cordon Bleu, a French-inspired dish loved worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Despite its French name, Chicken Cordon Bleu's exact origins are debated, but it became widely popular in the U.S. during the 1960s.
